      • UnPacker

        public UnPacker(java.lang.String inputFile,
        java.lang.String outputFile)
        Creates a new UnPacker
        Parameters:
        inputFile - name of the file to be unpacked
        outputFile - name the unpacked file

    • Method Detail

      • unpack

        public void unpack()
        Unpacks a packed file

      • readByte

        public void readByte()
        Reads one byte and adds the bits in to a queue

      • makeHuffmanTree

        public void makeHuffmanTree()
        Constructs a Huffman tree It first reads the Huffman codes written in the beginning of a packed file. Then based on the codes the tree is constructed.

      • addNodeToTree

        public void addNodeToTree(java.lang.String code,
                 int character,
                 Node node)
        Adds a new node to the Huffman tree The Huffman code tells the place in the tree that the node must be added to. Every node added is a leaf node, so whenever needed, additional internal nodes are also created.
        Parameters:
        code - the Huffman code
        character - the value of the character field in a leaf node
        node - root node of the tree

      • readHuffmanCodes

        public void readHuffmanCodes()
        Reads the Huffman codes stored in the beginning of the file and stores to codes in to a table in the class HuffmanTree.

      • readAmountOfHuffmanCodes

        public int readAmountOfHuffmanCodes()
        Checks how many different Huffman codes has been used to pack the file The first number in the beginning of the file tells how many different Huffman codes has been used to pack the file (=how many different characters the file has). This information is needed, because the Huffman codes are also written in the beginning of the file, and the number must be know to read them.
        Returns:
        amount of different Huffman codes

      • byteToBits

        public boolean[] byteToBits(int input)
        Changes one byte into bits which are stored into a boolean table
        Parameters:
        input - byte to be changed
        Returns:
        boolean table that includes the bits

      • findCode

        public int findCode()
        Finds the Huffman code When we read a file bit by bit, the bits can uniquely be changed to Huffman codes by traversing the tree. If the bit red is "0" we travel to the left, otherwise we travel to the right. When we reach a leaf node, we have found the Huffman code.
        Returns:
        the Huffman code that was found

      • getHuffmanTree

        public HuffmanTree getHuffmanTree()
        Getter for the HuffmanTree
        Returns:
        the root node of the tree

      • getBitQueue

        public java.util.Queue getBitQueue()
        Getter for the bitQueue
        Returns:
        the bitQueue
